reviewText: Ok, silliness aside, I'm SO GLAD I stumbled upon this in Best Buy, yesterday. The clarity is good (not HD quality, but I'm not completely complaining), coloration is bright, sound is good... I just wish some special features were in these three disks(I'm guessing Volume 2 has it).I wasn't expecting Jap dub or subtitles with this, since, honestly, there WERE things cut out in the Eng versions (nothing major, just some things that wouldn't fly for Sat morning airwaves), and the dialog (*rolls eyes* thanks Jeff Nimoy)and characters are changed so much (how Jap Mimi is more of a sheltered ditz compared Eng Mimi being a semi-spoiled primadonna) that having both would be a bit too much work for Flatiron to initially do (Heck, if Shout only gave me dubbed Medabots, and not Jap dub... I can see the trend).I'll eventually buy the 2nd Volume of the First Season, and hope Flatiron will produce Tamers, soon enough.
summary: Why was I not informed this was out?
Title: N/A

reviewText: I remember Digimon from watching it in my younger days when everyone was Pokemon crazy. This set contains three discs that have the first 21 episodes of season 1. It would be great if they had the original Japanese audio tracks but it is English only. They didn't even bother with adding subtitles for the death and hard of hearing.If you compare the animation to the more recent series of Digimon, it is ok. The color and pictures are least clean and bright. You will hear characters talk even if you don't see their lips moving in some scenes.As for the series it self, to those that don't known, seven kids that where at camp got pulled into the Digital World and paired with seven creatures known as Digimon, Digital Monsters. What made this series better then Pokemon for me is that the strength of the Digimon was tied to the heart and will as well as certain characteristic of the person they were partnered with. Also the Digimon could speak which makes it easy to understand what they are saying.This DVD set mainly focus on the kids and Digimon first meeting and learning about what is going on while they are on File Island. They end up fight some Digimon that are wild or have been corrupted by a black gear. This leads up to the main battle with the series first major villain, Devimon.After the battle with Devimon, they move on to the main land and start collecting crest that allow them to tape into certain characteristic that each kids possesses which allows the Digimon to become more powerful as they battle and hide from the second major villain, Etamon.

reviewText: One of my favorite anime shows returns on DVD format. I'm glad this is released to the people who like early 00's anime and I've been a big since late 1999 and early 2000. The story follows Tai and his friends, Matt, Sora, Izzy, Mimi, T.K.(Matts younger kid brother), and Joe(the oldest and responsible one of the group). The kids and their Digimon fight off wild Digimon,they also can digivolve from small little Digimon to bigger and more powerful Digimon. The kids makes friends with some of the Digimon on the island and battle and fight there first challenge Devimon! They manage to defeat him and his Black Gears that ran the island, then come across Gennai, an old man who guides the young heroes. He tells them to come to the Server Continent where they find tags and crest witch will allow their Digimon to digivolve more. They get some help from there Digimon friends and a Whamon(who had a Black Gear in him). They get to Server and find their Crest but they also have run ins with there second opponent(and my personal favorite) Etemon. Now here is where the Crest play a big part in the series because in the final battle with Etemon, Greymon Digivolves into Metal Greymon(his Ultimate form)and destroys him but both Tai and Metal Greymon get sucked into a warp hole back to Tokyo Japan(the kids home country). Tai and Koromon(who's in his in training form) goes to his place and sees it's the same day when the kids first when to the Digi World. Then to their surprise they find Kari(Tai's younger kid sister who stayed home from summer camp cause she got sick with a summer cold) home alone because their mom and dad went to see their grandma. Tai thinks this will be a good time to kick back and relax but when Tai see Digimon on the television and he sees that when they got back Digimon was coming through the warp hole and are making chaos in both worlds. So after a battle with Ogermon Agumon(now in his rookie form) and Tai decide to back to the Digi World and help the others. Tai didn't want to leave his sister behind but it's too dangerous for her, but in future episodes she'll find her own way to get to the Digi World and will play a big part in the series.
Title: N/A
